yes, but you can only have one application that is currently using the terminal (other programs can be running in background)
so how do i exit a terminal app without quitting it?
you mean send it to the background? you type "command &" to send it to the background so it doesn't use the current terminal
suppose i launch transmission and want to "minimize" it in the terminal
do ctrl + z to send it to the background, but that will freeze the application sort of "suspending it" to get it back, type fg
but I would just recommend learning screen if you're not going to use multiple xterms/ a window manager
may I ask why you aren't using a window manager?
why don't you just use multiple xterm windows?
